sense.name: Invent in one's imagination, possibly as a lie.
sense.examples: She vamped up an excuse for not attending the meeting. Don't vamp something up just to have something to say.

sense.name: Fix (something old) with a new part; improve.
sense.examples: He vamped up and old speech for the commencement address. She vamped the car with some new parts. She vamped up security all over the house.

sense.name: Act seductively (with someone).
sense.examples: He vamped all around that party. She vamped me with that cosmic kind of love.

sense.name: Provide a shoe with a new vamp.
sense.commentary: Note: this is a subsense of Sense 2. Use this sense for shoes.
sense.examples: He vamped my shoes as well as repaired the stitching.
